intro: Conospermum amoenum, commonly known as the silver-leaved conospermum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its attractive, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Conospermum amoenum thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for coastal and Mediterranean climates.
